comments.body: So this turned out harder than anticipated. We would not properly rename packages before, which would also pop up in signatures.
huh, interesting. Great job finding this!
I have no idea actually why the package type and module type is different, but I don't think this will actually break anything. If it will, I will probably need to figure it out :S

@@ -1,1 +291,295 @@          // to make sure we always use renamed package
          // what is saved in renames is actually companion module of a package
          val renamedOwnerIndex =
            owners.indexWhere(s => history.renames.contains(s.companionModule))
          if (renamedOwnerIndex < 0 && history.tryShortenName(name)) NoPrefix

> Previously, the rewrite would insert names like `Value` in the position
of a path dependent type such as `Day.Value` even if the `Value` in
scope had a conflicting type `Bool.Value`. Now, when querying the
scope we take into account the prefix from where the symbols in scope
origin.

> The implementation in this PR is probably incorrect for some cases. I
had to use a hacky workaround for the custom `PrettyType` type. Either
way, this diff makes the test suite pass and allow us to move on.
